definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to gather/to collect/collected works/classifier for sections of a TV series etc: episode

sentences.english: Under certain situation the equivalence of open set condition and strong open set condition are discussed in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 文章讨论开集条件与强开集条件是否等价的问题。

sentences.english: Under certain situation the equivalence of open set condition and strong open set condition are discussed in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 文章讨论开集条件与强开集条件是否等价的问题。

sentences.english: The self-similar sets satisfying the open condition have been studied.
sentences.chinese: 讨论了满足开集条件的自相似集。

sentences.english: The boundary of A contains a nonempty open set.
sentences.chinese: 的边界包含一个非空开集。

definition: to go to market/to go to a fair
the traditional Chinese calendar/the lunar calendar
New Year's Day in the lunar calendar
(of a store, stock market etc) to open for trading/to make the first transaction of the day
to shop in preparation for Chinese New Year
to set up a vendor's stall in the street
